result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman Lee Trepanier

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson (22CF69) and Attorney Gabriel Pollak(20CT143 and 21CT129) in court for Norman Lee Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Anderson indicates offer has been received, and will be making counter offer.  Request adjournment for further negations.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Norman Lee Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Anderson  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:57 AM Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Anderson indicates DEF would like to proceed with prelim.  11:57AM State calls witness, DET Jay Poplin.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  12:03PM Witness identifies witness.  State tenders witness.  Atty Anderson cross examines witness.  12:06PM  Atty Anderson tenders witness.  State has no additional questions for witness.  Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Anderson has no witnesses.  State requests bind over.  Atty Anderson makes argument.  Court finds PC and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets ARGN for 5/24/22 at 1:30PM.  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

09:24 AM Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson appears by zoom.  Defendant Norman Lee Trepanier in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 3.   Attny Anderson request preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

10:37AM DEF Norman Lee Trepanier in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alsyja Otten (special appearance) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF qualifies for public defender appointment, but conflict with office is noted.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance 3/8/22 at 8:30AM.  

COURT:  CBS $500   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
